main event: A bright object was observed pacing a car in Greensboro, North Carolina, on September 12, 1952, moving at high speed and reported by a local inspector.
interesting points: The object was described as grey, solid, and large, matching or exceeding the size of the car,The object was observed at altitudes ranging from 500 to 600 feet and then 300 feet when it disappeared.,Witnesses noted the object traveling initially at 600 miles per hour before increasing speed beyond detection.,Reports indicate that this event spurred interest from the Air Technical Intelligence Center.,The sightings were part of a larger investigation related to UFOs reported in the area during that period.
witness description: Inspector R.C., a resident with a technical background connected to the University of North Carolina since 1946.
